steps.text: In tutorial two, you observed how hosts communicate using switches. Now, it's time for a big secret: switches are primarily used for INTRA-SUBNET communication. Now, let's delve into INTER-SUBNET communication.

Intra-subnet communication is employed when communicating among a group of hosts within the same local network. For instance, all the devices communicating on the University of Oklahoma's network represent an example of intra-subnet communication.

Inter-subnet communication occurs when you're communicating between different subnetworks. For instance, if you're attempting to communicate with someone a couple of football fields away, simply shouting won't suffice. A more effective solution would involve a mediator to relay the information between the two distant points.
Now you are going to send information to the destination through the router.
On the "Node" tab you should see other options besides Ping. Don't be afraid to try those out!
